syllabus:
The aim of this fiction selection course is to provide a general survey of the representative works of fiction by some major British novelists.  In addition to traditional discussion of characterization and plot, we will focus on the historical, social contexts of these works.   For example, Elizabeth Gaskell\`s North and South, besides interweaving intriguing twisting plots of traditional romance, provides an acute social criticism of industrialization, class discrepancy, the discrepancy between mill owner and the workers, between the rich and the poor.   We will also pay particular attention on the depiction of London in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, especially represented in the works by Charles Dickens, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, and Oscar Wilde.  

  

We will discuss the following works:

Elizabeth Gaskell, _North and South_. 

Charles Dickens,  _Our Mutual Friend_. 

\-----.  _The Mystery of Edwin Drood_. 

Oscar Wilde, _The Picture of Dorian Gray_. 

Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, _The Lost World_. 

\-----.  _The Narrative of John Smith_.   

  

A more detailed syllabus will be announced in the class.  You may start to read these works in the winter break to prepare for the class.
